title: Last season for Ohmwrecker?
body: This item has been with us since season 3 and manages to avoid getting deleted. A rioter posted during preseason that they will rework the item one last time but never ended up doing anything with it. Is this the end for Ohmwrecker?

Yeah, you hit the nail on the head.

Ohmwrecker is an item that doesn't offer the stats when you have it, with a gold price that keeps it out of the game until the active isn't very useful.

Unless a huge buff to turrets occurs, maybe they should consider moving the active to a cheap, stat-less item that builds in to a more stat-heavy support item without the active? Promote riskier early game plays as a trade off for not offering any actual defensive stats. But then it'd just become a win-more kind of deal.

Also its power opens up a lot of other potential team comps that would have weak tower diving.  Personally, I feel that the unpopularity of Ohmwrecker is less the strength of the item and more people being MAH META.

As in things like master yi untargetablilty or a super hard engage malphite (btw I actually have built OW on malph because making the entire map unsafe is hilarious) or zac fling in +ult.  Pantheon being able to literally tank 2 tower shots for 0 dmg etc.  There are just too many characters that don't need the item to pull off successful tower shenanigans.

Yeah, and all those shenanigans require the enemy to be already low or hyper specific timing.  In both cases, the opponents outplay the guy under the tower.

So yeah, if you are better than the guy you are diving then you don't need Ohmwrecker but that's the player's fault not the item's.

The problem is the passive being tied to turrets. With each turret removed the item devalues, so it goes backwards in efficiency. Which half links into another problem: By the time it's bought turrets are mostly gone. The way to 'solve' this is to incentivise Ohmwrecker as an early item. That, however, brings much worse gameplay and many more problems than the one it intends to solve. i.e., the tradeoff is not a good one. 

If Ohmwrecker is a good early buy, it fast becomes a mandatory buy and overshadows other itemisation. 
It encourages increased snowballing (which could enter the vicious cycle of buff towers => increased dependence on Ohmwrecker). 
It makes towers less safe and reduces the tension of sieges. 
It reduces the efficacy of other team comps. E.g., Split pushers rely on the safety of the team under turret to enable them to be absent. 

In short it's basically impossible to make Ohm a good buy without making it bat shit OP and having a detrimental effect on the game. It will be removed as we know it and reforged into an entirely new item.

Well you can laugh all you want but Ohmwrecker is still the only armor and cdr item that also offers health.

The stats on this item are great, the active is situational but when in the situation that it is usable its awesome.

The main reason I don't use it more is because I feel the crit damage reduction and the attack speed slow on Randuins is a staple when there are adc's on the map and potentially a Yasuo, and I usually only build 1 of these armor items unless I'm vs a full ad team.
Meanwhile atma's impaler & zephyr were removed despite being picked up more often than ohmwrcker, without even being reworked.
Now now, Ohmwrecker is a great CDR option if you- *pffffthahahaha*.
It is too expensive for the stats it gives and the active only works in metas where turrets are really powerful

Ohmwrecker needs to be either deleted, or overhauled entirely.

Personally, I would go with the latter as Riot, because as well all know - Mages need a solid item similar to Hexdrinker to counter AD Champs. Why not make Ohmwrecker that item? Make it give you a Physical Damage shield when you reach a health threshold.

Zhonyas isn't a direct counter to AD champions mid, it's only really a counter to Zed because of his ultimate.
Archangels Staff only works on some champions; Karthus, Anivia, Ryze

AP Champions need a Hexdrinker-like item, an item that gives good stats and a similar defense to AD. For some reason, Zhonyas is literally the only item.

It's still the only armor+CDR+health item in the game right now, so I don't see it being removed until they fill that slot.  Also, it's not inherently BAD, per-se, it's just outclassed by zz'rot which both share the same base item.

Also, as it was suggested months ago, if its active gained a different effect on allied towers, that would be a huge boost as a niche item for countering siege-heavy team comps.

Now I'm no professional, but I have the enthusiasm to make a new version of this item. The goal to provide both defensive and offensive viability in scenarios involving a turret. Either that be an enemy or an ally turret, it should be usable all the same to provide the most versatility. This item is also aimed towards mages.

----------------------------------------

{{item:3056}} : 

+250 Health
+35 Armor
+20 Magic Resist
+45 Ability Power

**Unique Active:** Target a nearby turret, giving it a ring of blue runes around it that circle it and spark with magic. Each half second, a blue pulse is sent around the turret, dealing 20-56 [+30% of ability power] damage to all enemies that are still in it's radius for 3 seconds. Goes on a 30 second cooldown once it expires.

Cost: 2900 gold
------------------------------------------

So basically, use it on your turret to defend against a siege or a turret dive. Use it on an enemy turret to zone them out of their own turret during a gank or a siege.
